definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
(of competition or fighting) intense/fierce/(of pain) acute/(of an expression of opinion) impassioned/vehement/(of a course of action) drastic/extreme
to provoke/to irritate/to upset/to stimulate/to excite/irritant
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to arouse/to evoke/to cause/to stir up

sentences.english: Black ant cant stand stimulation in a pet like the giant killer.
sentences.chinese: 黑蚁受不了激，一气之下就想对擎天下杀手。

sentences.english: If you find yourself in a riptide, don't panic.
sentences.chinese: 假如你发现自己被卷入激潮时，别惊慌。

sentences.english: The seas are rising cloud water, Wuzhou Fenglei induced shock.
sentences.chinese: 四海翻腾云水路，五洲震荡风雷激。

sentences.english: Track irregularity is an important excitation source which can cause vibration of the Traffic-Track system.
sentences.chinese: 轨道不平顺是引起车辆系统振动的重要激振源。

sentences.english: Don't dare the press to catch you in an indiscretion either.
sentences.chinese: 也不要激媒体当场捕捉到你的不检点行为。

sentences.english: And I will execute vengeance in wrath and in indignation among all the nations that have not given ear.
sentences.chinese: 对那不顺服的异民，我必在盛怒激忿之下施以报复。

sentences.english: He called younger's bluff to swim the river in public.
sentences.chinese: 他当众激年青人游过那条河。

sentences.english: Espree Bright White Shampoo whitens and brightens without the use of bleach and harsh chemicals.
sentences.chinese: 爱斯亮白洗毛水不含漂白剂和其它剌激的代学品。

sentences.english: She defied him to dive off the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 她激他从桥上跳入水中。

sentences.english: He called the younger's bluff to swim the deeply river in public.
sentences.chinese: 他当众激年轻人游过那条深河。

definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]
to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
